lead_paragraph: People fled inland or barricaded themselves in their homes on Thursday to escape what could be dangerous flooding, blackouts and 140-mile-per-hour winds.

byline.contributor: Frances Robles reported from Titusville, Richard Pérez-Peña from New York, and Lizette Alvarez from Port St. Lucie, Fla. Reporting was contributed by Richard Fausset and Jess Bidgood from Charleston, S.C.; Azam Ahmed and Nick Madigan from Miami; Les Neuhaus from Jacksonville, Fla.; Alan Blinder from Orlando, Fla.; and Paco Nuñez from the Bahamas.
byline.original: By FRANCES ROBLES, RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA and LIZETTE ALVAREZ

headline.print_headline: Hurricane Aims at Florida Coast as Millions Flee
headline.main: Millions Flee or Brace as Hurricane Matthew Barrels Toward Florida

snippet: People fled inland or barricaded themselves in their homes on Thursday to escape what could be dangerous flooding, blackouts and 140-mile-per-hour winds....
abstract: Residents of central Florida prepare for Hurricane Matthew, whose deadly force hit Haiti leaving hundreds dead or wounded in its wake, by shuttering up their homes or evacuating altogether; Category 4 storm is predicted to be strongest to hit United States since 2005, year of Hurricanes Katrina, Rita and Wilma.
